yoast_head:
<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v25.2 - https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/ -->
<title>High Hopes | Bruce Springsteen</title>
<meta name="description" content="Recorded in New Jersey, LA, Atlanta, Australia and New York City, High Hopes marks Springsteen's 18th studio album and features the members of the E Street Band as well as guitarist Tom Morello." />
<meta name="robots" content="index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1" />
<link rel="canonical" href="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/high-hopes/" />
<meta property="og:locale" content="en_US" />
<meta property="og:type" content="article" />
<meta property="og:title" content="High Hopes" />
<meta property="og:description" content="Recorded in New Jersey, LA, Atlanta, Australia and New York City, High Hopes marks Springsteen's 18th studio album and features the members of the E Street Band as well as guitarist Tom Morello.Morello joined Springsteen on tour in Australia in 2013 and became, as Springsteen says, "my muse, pushing the rest of this project to another level."  Clarence Clemons, who passed away in 2011, and Danny Federici, who passed away in 2008, also appear on several songs of what Springsteen calls "some of our best unreleased material from the past decade."" />
<meta property="og:url" content="https://brucespringsteen.net/albums/high-hopes/" />
<meta property="og:site_name" content="Bruce Springsteen" />
<meta property="article:publisher" content="https://www.facebook.com/brucespringsteen" />
<meta property="article:modified_time" content="2023-05-04T17:08:16+00:00" />
<meta property="og:image" content="https://cdn-p.smehost.net/sites/e8622626f9584d40b1a8fce8dfa6f567/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/og-springsteen-high-hopes-front.jpg" />
	<meta property="og:image:width" content="1200" />
	<meta property="og:image:height" content="630" />
	<meta property="og:image:type" content="image/jpeg" />
<meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image" />
<meta name="twitter:title" content="High Hopes" />
<meta name="twitter:description" content="Recorded in New Jersey, LA, Atlanta, Australia and New York City, High Hopes marks Springsteen's 18th studio album and features the members of the E Street Band as well as guitarist Tom Morello.Morello joined Springsteen on tour in Australia in 2013 and became, as Springsteen says, "my muse, pushing the rest of this project to another level."  Clarence Clemons, who passed away in 2011, and Danny Federici, who passed away in 2008, also appear on several songs of what Springsteen calls "some of our best unreleased material from the past decade."" />
<meta name="twitter:image" content="https://cdn-p.smehost.net/sites/e8622626f9584d40b1a8fce8dfa6f567/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/og-springsteen-high-hopes-front.jpg" />
<meta name="twitter:site" content="@springsteen" />

yoast_head_json.title: High Hopes | Bruce Springsteen
yoast_head_json.description: Recorded in New Jersey, LA, Atlanta, Australia and New York City, High Hopes marks Springsteen's 18th studio album and features the members of the E Street Band as well as guitarist Tom Morello.
yoast_head_json.og_description: Recorded in New Jersey, LA, Atlanta, Australia and New York City, High Hopes marks Springsteen's 18th studio album and features the members of the E Street Band as well as guitarist Tom Morello.Morello joined Springsteen on tour in Australia in 2013 and became, as Springsteen says, "my muse, pushing the rest of this project to another level."  Clarence Clemons, who passed away in 2011, and Danny Federici, who passed away in 2008, also appear on several songs of what Springsteen calls "some of our best unreleased material from the past decade."
yoast_head_json.twitter_description: Recorded in New Jersey, LA, Atlanta, Australia and New York City, High Hopes marks Springsteen's 18th studio album and features the members of the E Street Band as well as guitarist Tom Morello.Morello joined Springsteen on tour in Australia in 2013 and became, as Springsteen says, "my muse, pushing the rest of this project to another level."  Clarence Clemons, who passed away in 2011, and Danny Federici, who passed away in 2008, also appear on several songs of what Springsteen calls "some of our best unreleased material from the past decade."
